intro: Paraquilegia, commonly known as the "false squill," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Liliaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and includes several species that are often mistaken for true squill due to their similar appearance. The plants typically have showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Paraquilegia species are herbaceous perennials that thrive in well-drained soils and full sun. They are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
